metadata.titel_preek: The Agony of Love and the Depths of Mercy

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of self-destruction
inner core of being is love
pay a ransom, mortgage the house
enough credits to come into the presence of God
there is no health in us
erred and strayed like lost sheep

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Godâ€™s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

cognitieve_implicaties: God's resources are finite yet fully given
onbedoelde_consequenties: God as a depleted or exhausted entity

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the physical reality of blood loss to describe abstract 'grace'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the 'Relational' (Parent) and 'Economic' (Debt) domains by framing the economic costs (ransom, mortgage) as expressions of parental desperation.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: SIN IS SICKNESS (no health in us)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Sickness implies a lack of agency/need for healing, while 'offender' implies moral guilt/need for punishment.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: One cannot be both a victim of a virus and a criminal perpetrator of the same act simultaneously.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Subordinating the economic transaction to the relational motive.

sterktes.beschrijving: Revitalizes the 'Dead' Trinitarian formula by mapping it onto the 'Living' image of a parent with a runaway child.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Paul will try almost any argument... like a parent agonizing because a child has fallen in with a fast crowd.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing so heavily on the 'desperate parent' and 'anorexic child,' sin risks being viewed purely as self-harm rather than rebellion against God.
risicos.voorbeeld: maybe he is hooked on drugs... maybe she is anorexic
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may lose the sense of 'Fear of the Lord' despite the preacher's later attempt to reclaim it.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The domestic crisis of a parent losing a child.
sub_worlds: The ancient Roman travel/epistolary world of Paul
The liturgical world of the 1976 Prayer Book

deictic_shifts.naar_wereld: The inner life of the Trinity
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates an emotional bridge to an abstract doctrine.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforces the paternal image but adds the nuance of 'desperation' and 'foolishness' for love.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Repudiates 'petty record keeping' and 'adding up points'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly connected to the Book of Common Prayer and the history of the General Confession.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, specifically the 'Agonizing Parent' metaphor. This is used as a cognitive key to unlock the Trinity. It effectively moves from the Economic (Debt/Credits) to the Relational (Mercy/Love).

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washed in the blood / Blood of the Son
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'blood' more explicitly to the 'neglect of health' mentioned in the parent analogy.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God's love is like a parent who gives their own blood in a transfusion to a child who has tried to cut them out of their life.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The tension between 'no health in us' (Medical) and 'miserable offenders' (Juridical).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Addiction' metaphor to bridge them: addiction is both a disease (no health) and involves choices (offense).

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests God lacks wisdom or sovereignty.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that this 'foolishness' is the 'wisdom of the cross' (1 Cor 1).

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To ground the 'depths' of Psalm 130 in something more structural than just emotion.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to make the doctrine of the Trinity accessible and emotionally resonant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'agonized' tone; CMT reveals that this tone is a cognitive necessity to map the 'Trinitarian interrelatedness'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning, CMT shows how the preacher uses the 'Parent' schema to overwrite the 'Accountant' schema.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's use of 'Verticality' (Out of the depths) is the primary spatial anchor for the entire second half of the sermon.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: last ditch of our messed-up lives
appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'Depth' as a container metaphor for human misery and 'Light/Dawn' as a source-path-goal metaphor for hope.
